title: Yakuza 0
notes:
Great performance. Has to be started 1st with the steam-runtime (native runtime off). To get the steam controller working, the hid_steam kernel driver has to be blacklisted.
The special move works, everything's good.
It runs flawlessly but it always crashes in the fight tutorial when throwing a special attack. so now i have to live in that small chunk of street before the tutorial for the rest of my life.
title: Yakuza 0

notes:
Run in borderless window. Only a mild performance hit compared to native. <25% @4k
Noticed a single extremely minor graphical glitch in that flames from flamethrowers don't appear. Might be a port issue for all I know.
title: Yakuza 0

notes: just as fine on windows

notes: Good performance and no noticeable graphical errors. Would be Platinum if it weren't for the Xbox controller not working properly unless the game is started in Big Picture mode.

notes: No tweaking needed to get the game up and running. Played with DualShock 3 and 4 controllers. Both functioned flawlessly (until the DualShock 3 died - hardware failure).

title: Yakuza 0

gpu: X.Org Radeon RX 580 Series (POLARIS10, DRM 3.26.0, 4.18.7-1-default, LLVM 6.0.1)
notes: The game runs fine, but as soon as the first boss cutscene appears, the gpu freezes. There is a save file right after the boss fight, however it crashes in certain parts of Sotenbori (though this is apparently a problem with all RX series cards). And finally, you can't progress throught the story after chapter 13 due to a cutscene freezing the gpu, again.
title: Yakuza 0

notes: unable connect to server fixed by running steam in runtime with terminal command: STEAM_RUNTIME=1 steam Now getting to black screen with yakuza zero logo on right corner until it crashes. (game works using lutris but cannot save the game! also xbox controller not working.)

As others have stated, the game always crashes when heavy attack is used in first tutorial battle, making the game essentially unplayable, since it is impossible to progress.

However, this bug also affects several Windows users. I will be trying it on another distro with different nvidia driver.
